proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.writing

Class WritingThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
      • java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
        • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.writing.WritingThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService

    public class WritingThread
extends java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
    The ThreadPoolExecutor that manages the writes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  WritingThread.WrappedRequestHandler
      An internal class, that is used to wrap the RequestHandlers whose data shall be written.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor

        java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.AbortPolicy, java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.CallerRunsPolicy, java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.DiscardOldestPolicy, java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.DiscardPolicy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WritingThread()
      The WritingThread has a maximumPoolSize of 1, so no two writes occur at the same time, to avoid that two writers open the same file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enqueueWrite(RequestEvent aRequestEvent, RequestHandler theRequestHandler)
      This method wraps the RequestHandler that is given to it in a WritingThread.WrappedRequestHandler, and then puts this WritingThread.WrappedRequestHandler in its queue of tasks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WritingThread

        public WritingThread()
        The WritingThread has a maximumPoolSize of 1, so no two writes occur at the same time, to avoid that two writers open the same file. corePoolSize and keepAliveTime are not important, because the queue saving the tasks has infinite length.

    • Method Detail

      • enqueueWrite

        public void enqueueWrite(RequestEvent aRequestEvent,
                RequestHandler theRequestHandler)
        This method wraps the RequestHandler that is given to it in a WritingThread.WrappedRequestHandler, and then puts this WritingThread.WrappedRequestHandler in its queue of tasks. Thereby RequestHandler.dumpData() is called for every enqueued RequestHandler, but only one at a time is allowed to write.
        Parameters:
        aRequestEvent - The state of the RequestHandler that is to be enqueued. MUST be RequestEvent.READY_TO_WRITE
        theRequestHandler - The RequestHandler that is to be enqueued, so its data is written
